text.0: The NEJM Race and Medicine topic page features a selection of NEJM articles on race and medicine with implications for improving patient care, professional training, research, and public health. All articles assembled on the page are freely available.

text.4: In this audio interview conducted on November 18, 2020, the editors are joined by Dr. Charlotte J. Haug, international correspondent of the Journal, to discuss the recent vaccine trial results and the state of the pandemic in Europe. #COVID19 #SARSCoV2
text.5: In this phase 2 trial, children and young adults with newly diagnosed overt type 1 diabetes were randomly assigned to receive golimumab, a human monoclonal antibody to tumor necrosis factor α, or placebo. Golimumab resulted in better endogenous insulin production than placebo.
text.6: Endometrial carcinoma is diagnosed in about 58,500 women in the United States per year. It is linked with obesity, excess estrogen, and the Lynch syndrome. Oral contraceptives lower the risk by 30 to 40%. Most patients undergo surgery with or without radiation therapy.
